page.title: 10BRIDGWATER AND TAUNTON CANAL
page.content: The Bridgwater and Taunton Canal runs through our area.The canal does not carry commercial freight now but it is still important in the area.It is a drainage channel,supplies water to industry,provides water for fire_figh_ ting and supplies a drinking water reservoir.It is also of environmental and recreational benefit to the area. The one canal building left is the Engine House at Charlton.It is a ruin but there are plans to make it safe and use it as an information and picnic site.All along the towpath are concrete pill boxes dating from the Second World War. Clear notices show it is an offence to obstruct the towpath,to ride bikes or horses,to leave litter,fire guns, throw stones,pollute the canal or fail to obtain the correct licence for a craft navigating the canal.
